doc.title: PEP-FOLD

div.p: PEP-FOLD is a service for the de novo prediction of peptide conformation from amino acid sequence. It is based on a Hidden Markov Model derived Structural Alphabet that describes the conformation of a polypeptidic chain as a series of local overlapping canonical conformations of fragments of 4 amino acids. PEP-FOLD 3 comes with a new 3D engine exploiting HMM sub optimal trajectory sampling that is as efficient as that of PEP-FOLD1 and PEP-FOLD2 for linear peptides, but faster, making possible to open new features.

ol.li: Extended peptide size (from 5 to 50 amino acids).
Constrained structural sampling (maintaining user specified regions invariant).

div.div: Note: PEP-FOLD3, while faster, does not presently manage disulfide bonds as efficiently as PEP-FOLD2. Please use former PEP-FOLD server to this goal. We remind that for a number of disulfide bond larger than 2, PEP-FOLD shows limited performance.

doc.authors: Lamiable A, Thévenet P, Rey J, Vavrusa M, Derreumaux P, Tufféry P.
doc.reference: PEP-FOLD3: faster de novo structure prediction for linear peptides in solution and in complex. Nucleic Acids Res. 2016 Jul 8;44(W1):W449-54.

div.div:
Use this input field to specify the amino acid sequence of the peptide. It must be in the FASTA format. For more information about the format, please read the sequence format tutorial (Mobyle Tutorials section, on the left).
Note: Simulated sequence length must be comprised between 5 and 50 amino-acids.
Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1dep_A for chain A of the 1dep entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.

div.label:
Run label?
This label will correspond to the first field of the file names of the run, available for download.

Number of simulations?
100 200
Number of independent simulations to be run.
Usually, 100 is enough to get a good idea of peptide candidate conformations. In some cases however, 200 simulations can lead to improvement.

Generator?
fbt ts4 ts5
Generator in use for the runs.
Usually, the forward backtrack (fbt) is rather good, but taboo-sampling (ts4, ts5) can be a better option for peptides in interaction. ts5 should be used for peptide sizes longer than 10 amino acids.

Sort models by?
sOPEP tm
Depending on the selected item, clusters will be sorted by:
sOPEP: sOPEP energy.
tm: apollo predicted TM score.
The best models returned will follow this sort.
Note: this is not effective for peptide-protein complex generation, where sOPEP ranking only is effective.

Perform MQA?
Yes No
If true, then perform the Model Quality Assessment using Apollo.

MonteCarlo steps:?
30000 0
The number of Monte Carlo steps.

div.div: This section makes possible to bias the modeling by imposing local conformations for parts of the models. Bias is possible either by specifying a reference structure together with a mask indicating the regions of the structure for which the local conformation of this structure will be imposed, or by specifying a mask alone, in which case the local conformation imposed will be that of the optimal prediction from amino acid sequence.

Specify here a reference structure (PDB Format). It MUST be the same sequence as the peptide amino acid sequence input (see upper fields). To make this structure taken into account, you have to specify a mask (next parameter), whose sequence must match exactly the sequence of the peptide, but using upper/lower case (see mask help). Depending on the mask, local conformations from this structure will be used to bias modeling.
Choosing the db item and the PDB, you can directly select chains by entering e.g. 1timA for chain A of the 1tim entry. Choosing SCOP, the ids are on the form d1tima_.

Use this input field to specify the residues of the reference structure allowed to change conformation. It must be in the FASTA format. Upper case residues mean residues with conformational flexibility. Lower case residues are for residues for which the reference structure local conformation will be kept. Note PEP-FOLD considers overlapping fragments of 4 residue length. First 4 residues correspond to the first fragment and MUST have the same case. Following residues determine the conformational flexibility of the fragment ending at the position. For more information about the format, please read the PEP-FOLD3 service help.
Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1tim_A for chain A of the 1tim entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.

This section makes possible to generate candidate peptide-protein complex posed. It requires the specification of a receptor protein structure and of a list of residues of the receptor that are expected to interact with the peptide.

Specify here a structure for a receptor (PDB Format). This structure will be used together with the receptor patch definition to generate receptor-peptide complex decoys.
Important: The residue numbers MUST start at 1 (otherwise PEP-FOLD3 will fail).
Choosing the db item and the PDB, you can directly select chains by entering e.g. 1timA for chain A of the 1tim entry. Choosing SCOP, the ids are on the form d1tima_.

fieldset.legend: Residues defining the interaction patch (the residues must be specified ONE per line)?

div.div:
The residues must be specified ONE per line. Each residues must be represented in the following format that does not contain any white-space or special character, and uses underscore as field delimiter: _CHAIN-ID_RESIDUE-3-LETTERS-CODE _RESIDUE-NUMBER_INSERTION-CODE_.
Example: _A_THR_1__,_A_THR_2__,_A_ILE_7__.
Note: Blank chain Ids and blank insertion codes are accepted (and result in double _). Residue numbers are those of the PDB file.

div.label:
Run the service with preset data?
No 3D modeling Biased modeling Peptide protein complex
These demos provides a quick view of the features of PEP-FOLD3, using a number of conformations limited to only 24 instead of 100 (or 200) for standard runs. Three different facilities are proposed:
3D modeling from a single peptide sequence: the sequence of the triple helix bundle FAF-1 UBA Domain (PDB 3e21) will be used.
3D modeling specifying local conformation constraints, from a pre-existing 3D model: the sequence of the triple helix bundle FAF-1 UBA Domain (PDB 3e21) will be used.
3D modeling close to a protein receptor: the HAGPIA peptide will be folded on the APO conformation of CYPA given the interacting residues from the complex (PDB: 1AWR).

div.div: Note: By selecting an option different from "No", all input parameters entered above will be superseded by data preset to run the selected demonstration.

Use this input field to specify the amino acid sequence of the peptide. It must be in the FASTA format. For more information about the format, please read the sequence format tutorial (Mobyle Tutorials section, on the left).
Note: Simulated sequence length must be comprised between 5 and 50 amino-acids.
Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1dep_A for chain A of the 1dep entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.

Specify here a reference structure (PDB Format). It MUST be the same sequence as the peptide amino acid sequence input (see upper fields). To make this structure taken into account, you have to specify a mask (next parameter), whose sequence must match exactly the sequence of the peptide, but using upper/lower case (see mask help). Depending on the mask, local conformations from this structure will be used to bias modeling.
Choosing the db item and the PDB, you can directly select chains by entering e.g. 1timA for chain A of the 1tim entry. Choosing SCOP, the ids are on the form d1tima_.

Use this input field to specify the residues of the reference structure allowed to change conformation. It must be in the FASTA format. Upper case residues mean residues with conformational flexibility. Lower case residues are for residues for which the reference structure local conformation will be kept. Note PEP-FOLD considers overlapping fragments of 4 residue length. First 4 residues correspond to the first fragment and MUST have the same case. Following residues determine the conformational flexibility of the fragment ending at the position. For more information about the format, please read the PEP-FOLD3 service help.
Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1tim_A for chain A of the 1tim entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.

Specify here a structure for a receptor (PDB Format). This structure will be used together with the receptor patch definition to generate receptor-peptide complex decoys.
Important: The residue numbers MUST start at 1 (otherwise PEP-FOLD3 will fail).
Choosing the db item and the PDB, you can directly select chains by entering e.g. 1timA for chain A of the 1tim entry. Choosing SCOP, the ids are on the form d1tima_.

The residues must be specified ONE per line. Each residues must be represented in the following format that does not contain any white-space or special character, and uses underscore as field delimiter: _CHAIN-ID_RESIDUE-3-LETTERS-CODE _RESIDUE-NUMBER_INSERTION-CODE_.
Example: _A_THR_1__,_A_THR_2__,_A_ILE_7__.
Note: Blank chain Ids and blank insertion codes are accepted (and result in double _). Residue numbers are those of the PDB file.

These demos provides a quick view of the features of PEP-FOLD3, using a number of conformations limited to only 24 instead of 100 (or 200) for standard runs. Three different facilities are proposed:
3D modeling from a single peptide sequence: the sequence of the triple helix bundle FAF-1 UBA Domain (PDB 3e21) will be used.
3D modeling specifying local conformation constraints, from a pre-existing 3D model: the sequence of the triple helix bundle FAF-1 UBA Domain (PDB 3e21) will be used.
3D modeling close to a protein receptor: the HAGPIA peptide will be folded on the APO conformation of CYPA given the interacting residues from the complex (PDB: 1AWR).

The visualization is based on top of the Protein Viewer (http://biasmv.github.io/pv/). Being JavaScript / WebGL based, the behavior still depends on the browser (but remains largely better than with JAVA based visualizers).

xhtml:div.style: width:96%; font-size:9pt; border-left:4px solid #cccccc; border-right:4px solid #cccccc; padding: 0 10px 0 10px; text-align:left;
xhtml:div.xhtml:p: To browse the html results page more easily, please click on the full screen view button. Then you can also save it by using File > Save Page as of your web browser.

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Cluster 1 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 2 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 3 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 4 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)
Cluster 5 best conformation (according to sort criterion - see the clustering report)

Structural alphabet (SA)prediction profile. The probabilities, at each position of the sequence, of the 27 SA letters are sorted from helical (red), coil (blue) to extended (green).
Note: SA letters are 4 residue length, so the profile is of the size of the amino acid sequence minus 3.

Choosing the db item, you can directly select the sequence of a PDB file specifying an identifier on the form: 1dep_A for chain A of the 1dep entry. The chain identifier is mandatory.

format.code: ( "", " --shake_model "+str(iRef) )[ (value is not None) and (iRefMask is not None) ]

parameter.name: residues_list
parameter.prompt: Residues defining the interaction patch (the residues must be specified ONE per line)

comment.div:
The residues must be specified ONE per line. Each residues must be represented in the following format that does not contain any white-space or special character, and uses underscore as field delimiter: _CHAIN-ID_RESIDUE-3-LETTERS-CODE _RESIDUE-NUMBER_INSERTION-CODE_.
Example: _A_THR_1__,_A_THR_2__,_A_ILE_7__.
Note: Blank chain Ids and blank insertion codes are accepted (and result in double _). Residue numbers are those of the PDB file.

xhtml:fieldset.xhtml:legend: Residues defining the interaction patch (the residues must be specified ONE per line)

div.div:
The residues must be specified ONE per line. Each residues must be represented in the following format that does not contain any white-space or special character, and uses underscore as field delimiter: _CHAIN-ID_RESIDUE-3-LETTERS-CODE _RESIDUE-NUMBER_INSERTION-CODE_.

parameter.name: demo
parameter.prompt: Run the service with preset data

comment.div:
These demos provides a quick view of the features of PEP-FOLD3, using a number of conformations limited to only 24 instead of 100 (or 200) for standard runs. Three different facilities are proposed:
3D modeling from a single peptide sequence: the sequence of the triple helix bundle FAF-1 UBA Domain (PDB 3e21) will be used.
3D modeling specifying local conformation constraints, from a pre-existing 3D model: the sequence of the triple helix bundle FAF-1 UBA Domain (PDB 3e21) will be used.
3D modeling close to a protein receptor: the HAGPIA peptide will be folded on the APO conformation of CYPA given the interacting residues from the complex (PDB: 1AWR).

message.text: You must specify either the demo or input a sequence.

Run the service with preset data?

3D modeling close to a protein receptor: the HAGPIA peptide will be folded on the APO conformation of CYPA given the interacting residues from the complex (PDB: 1AWR).

jobState.name: https://mobyle.rpbs.univ-paris-diderot.fr/data/services/servers/local/programs/PEP-FOLD3.xml
jobState.commandLine: python /service/env/PEPFOLD3.5/PEPFOLD3.py -s iSeq.fasta -l 32comp --nRuns 100 --generator fbt --sortKey sOPEP --mcSteps 30000 --receptor nsp7_4342.pdb --receptor_patch residues_list.data
